Writes an apology within his narrative for having changed someone through his words.

Feels and acknowledges a deep sense of loss and fondness, expressing love and regret.
Decides to embrace writing and starts typing a new story on a laptop, showing initiative and adapting to new tools.
Expresses worry that others will think he is crazy for his story, indicating some self-doubt and lack of confidence.
Neatly cooks dinner for himself, showing self-care and organizational skill.
Walks his dog alone and goes for runs, indicating responsible personal habits.
Hesitates before starting to write, hands hovering over keys, demonstrating some internal uncertainty.
Publishes a book and personally reflects on it, showing commitment and productive output.
Reads aloud his writing to a small crowd with evident appreciation for love and creativity, acknowledges the miracle of creation humbly.
Welcomes Cyrus into his family circle and smiles warmly at friends, sharing a moment of lighthearted connection.
Engages sincerely with his therapist, showing openness and gratitude for feedback.
Reads aloud confidently and insightfully to a crowd, demonstrating eloquence and command of language.
Engages socially with family and acquaintances in a relaxed, respectful manner showing social ease and awareness.
Receives positive feedback from therapist on his earnestness and commitment to writing assignments.
Acknowledges the possibility that his experience might be a mental or imaginative phenomenon, showing self-reflection and openness.
Sings happily in the car with his dog Scotty, showing enjoyment of simple pleasures.
Apologizes politely when Scotty runs up to a stranger, demonstrating consideration and courteousness.
Pauses to engage with Ruby and shows interest in her by responding to her questions and reading her book, indicating openness and attentiveness.
Distracted momentarily and fails to respond immediately when Ruby asks if he liked the book, potentially showing inattentiveness.
Encourages Dr. Rosenthal to take a leap of faith and believe him despite a lack of clear explanation.
Drives confidently with Scotty happily by his side and engages in lighthearted behavior (singing along) showing ease and presence of mind.
Chases after Scotty when he runs off, demonstrating attentiveness and responsibility.
Stops himself from interrupting Ruby brusquely and manages the social interaction with politeness and curiosity.
Appears distracted and a bit absent-minded, as shown by replying 'I'm sorry, did you say something?' when Ruby asks if he liked the book.
Engages politely and sincerely with Ruby, responds warmly to her comments, agrees to 'start over' and sit with her, promises not to spoil the book.
Engages thoughtfully in conversation, responds confidently as a writer, manages social interaction smoothly with Ruby.
